result.execSummary:
The defendant Langston W. Mlinar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Felony Intimidation of a Victim [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 1:59 PM.
Defendant Langston W. Mlinar in court, in custody with Attorney David W. Field.   Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Count 3: State recommends 1 Year Initial Confinement followed by 2 Years of Extended Supervision.
Count 9: State recommends 3 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 5 Years of Extended Supervision (Concurrent to Count 3).
State offers Exhibits #1-12 and requests that they be sealed. Exhibits #1-12 are received and ordered sealed.
Defense recommends Probation with conditions as recommended by the agent including but not limited to a Mental Health Assessment.  Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
Count 3: Court sentences the Defendant to 1 Year of Initial Confinement followed by 1 Year of Extended Supervision.
Count 9: Court sentences the Defendant to 2 Years and 6 Months of Initial Confinement followed by 4 Years of Extended Supervision (Concurrent to Count 3).
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
No contact with K.D. or her residence, Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant is granted 180 days of sentence credit. Court finds the Defendant eligible for the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

(12:58 PM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz and attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Langston W. Mlinar in court, in custody. Attorney David W. Field in court for Langston W. Mlinar.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3: Domestic Substantial Battery and Count 9: Domestic Felony Intimidation of a Victim.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of Count 3 and Count 9.

Court orders a Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI) be completed and the parties are free to argue at sentencing. Attorney Field advises may have an alternate PSI completed. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
(Off record for scheduling.)
Court orders the PSI is due August 16, 2022.
Attorney Field advises filed a motion for bond modification and makes argument in favor of a bond reduction. State advises the State will stand mute and make no argument.
Court orders the motion to modify bond is denied.
Sentencing Hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 1:30 pm (1 hour) in person.
(Trial is removed from the calendar.)

Prior Convictions of witnesses and defendant. Parties stipulate to 2 prior convictions for Defendant.

Defense has remaining discovery and will review in the near future. 

Parties to appear at 8:30am on June 23, 2022. Trial to begin at 9am. This is a #1 case as there was a Speedy Trial Demand filed.
